title: The root schema
description: The root schema comprises the entire JSON document.

AdsOpts.title: The AdsOpts schema
AdsOpts.description: AdsOpts is the Primary configuration element for CICD in this project.

CI.title: The CI schema
CI.description: //CI (Continuous Integration - Set this section to true if you want the source binaries to be built out. In ordinary operation these should be true. Switches provided for ease of debugging only)

Enable.title: Enable
Enable.description: Set this section to true if you want the source binaries to be built out. In ordinary operation these should be true.

BuildFunctionApp.title: The BuildFunctionApp schema
BuildFunctionApp.description: Set this section to true if you want the source binaries to be built out. In ordinary operation these should be true.

BuildWebApp.title: The BuildWebApp schema
BuildWebApp.description: Set this section to true if you want the source binaries to be built out. In ordinary operation these should be true.

BuildAdsGoFastDatabase.title: The BuildAdsGoFastDatabase schema
BuildAdsGoFastDatabase.description: Set this section to true if you want the source binaries to be built out. In ordinary operation these should be true.

CD.title: The CD schema
CD.description: This configuration element controls continous deployment specifics

Enable.title: The Enable schema
Enable.description: Set to false if you want no continous deployment operations to occur.

ServicePrincipals.title: The ServicePrincipals schema
ServicePrincipals.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

DeploymentSP.title: The DeploymentSP schema
DeploymentSP.description: Set enable to true if you want the script to create the Deployment SP for you othwerise you need to provide the SP details in Secrets.json or if depoloying via GitHub Actions add in github secrets - https://github.com/Azure/actions-workflow-samples/blob/master/assets/create-secrets-for-GitHub-workflows.md#set-secret-with-azure-credentials

Enable.title: The Enable schema
Enable.description: Set enable to true if you want the script to create the Deployment SP for you othwerise you need to provide the SP details in Secrets.json or if depoloying via GitHub Actions add in github secrets - https://github.com/Azure/actions-workflow-samples/blob/master/assets/create-secrets-for-GitHub-workflows.md#set-secret-with-azure-credentials

Name.title: The Name schema
Name.description: Name of the Service Principal

ApplyNamePostFix.title: The ApplyNamePostFix schema
ApplyNamePostFix.description: If true then the script will add a hash based on the resource group name as a postfix to the objects name

WebAppAuthenticationSP.title: The WebAppAuthenticationSP schema
WebAppAuthenticationSP.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

Enable.title: The Enable schema
Enable.description: Set to true if you want the script to create the App Registration Used by the Web App to validate AAD authentication requests.

Name.title: The Name schema
Name.description: Name of the App Registration

ApplyNamePostFix.title: The ApplyNamePostFix schema
ApplyNamePostFix.description: If true then the script will add a hash based on the resource group name as a postfix to the objects name

ClientId.title: The ClientId schema
ClientId.description: The client id of the App Registration. If you have enable set to true then ignore this as your script will autopopulate once it creates the App Reg
